list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The battle ended in a triumph for the Romans.

list_definition.mean_english: hạnh phúc, niềm vui chiến thắng
list_definition.definition: a state of happiness, celebration, pride etc after a success

list_ex_of_english: Neither vision has triumphed, yet events since the late 1980s have continued to erode many of the certainties on which modern social science was based.
American political development offers no historical trajectory, no inevitable march of rights, no irresistible liberal triumphs.
The triumphs of science have been gained by studying facts.
The aggrandizing state has run amok and collectivism has triumphed across the globe.
Green revolution rices and wheats were one of the triumphs of conventional plant breeding.
In it, the notion of standard appeared at first to have triumphed.
Most of the major triumphs in eradicating disease in the past century have been through preventive methods.
He has triumphed where a large number of people have failed, because many of us have been very anxious to discuss the housing situation.
